Subject: RAM problem using mixture equilibrate command
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=228991298; y=vjFAkN2lYq6KP9ySnoW0vpITEAhtDIMgV3RqAQcO68n5WymFxQ

Dear Mr Goodwin,

I finally manage to use the mixture equilibrate command (I work with
Matlab6.5 in Windows environment) using Cantera1.6. I work with a
powerful pc desktop (3.4GHz-Cpu, 1024MB-RAM), but I have some problem,
since the model fill up all the memory... 
I work with an ideal gas phase and a solid carbon phase, doing some
iteration for several values of temperature and pressure.
I have seen in your Python demo (adiabatic.py) the following syntax: 

mix.equilibrate('HP', maxsteps = 1000,err = 1.0e-6, maxiter = 200,
loglevel=0)

where you fix the max number of iterations. There is a similar way to
do this in Matlab. I am not able to find it.

Thank you in advance.
Your sincerly.

Christian
